title.narrative: DIHR DEME SO human rights program 2014-2016

description.narrative: Programmets bas är verksamheten med barfotajurister, som med stor geografisk täckning och lokal förankring assisterar sårbara grupper i att skapa förutsättningar för åtnjutandet av grundläggande medborgerliga rättigheter och tillgång till rättslig prövning. Barfotajuristerna fungerar också som en sorts brygga mellan det informella och formella rättssystemet såtillvida att de även medlar i konflikter inom familjer som ofta kan lösas genom förlikning utan att tas genom det formella rättssystemet. Programmet stärker även sårbara gruppers tillgång till rättslig prövning genom sitt centra för rättshjälp (clinique juridique) i Bamako och sina två juridiska informationkontor (centre d'assistance juridique et judiciaire) i Bamako och Ségou. Vid ett kvinnofängelse i Bamako bedriver man kapacitetsbyggande verksamhet med fångarna. Den röda tråden i programmet är ökad tillgång till rättvisa, rättigheter och rättslig prövning för sårbara grupper, samt ökad möjlighet till samhälleligt deltagande.

The base of the program are the paralegals, who with a wide geographic coverage and solid local connection enable vulnerable groups to enjoy basic civil rights and access to justice. The paralegals also function as a bridge between the informal and formal legal systems inasmuch as they mediate in conflicts within families which can commonly be resolved through settlements without being taken to the formal justice system. The program also strengthen vulnerable group's access to justice through their legal aid clinic in Bamako and their two legal information offices in Bamako and Ségou. At a prison for women in Bamako the program have capacity building acitivities with the inmates. The silver thread in the program is access to justice and rights for vulnerable groups, and increased citizen participation.
To offer legal aid to vulnerable groups and to promote citizen participation in the areas of intervention.

tag.narrative: 10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: At the end of the project period, 2014-2017, the following overall conclusions can be made in relation to results: - The increase in registered births and marriages in the municipalities where DEME SO works is an indicator of the communities being more aware of their rights and able to claim them. There is also an increase in people attending debates and receiving legal guidance from paralegals. This is a positive trend and could mean a higher level of legal empowerment in these areas. - There has been an increase in the number of beneficiaries of the Legal Clinic (Bamako) and Legal Aid Offices (BAJJ, in Bamako and Ségou). 70% of users are women. Legal assistance to female detainees also increased. As for the victims of violations related to the crisis in Northern Mali, unfortunately only a single judgement has been delivered to the 36 pending cases. This is related to the slow pace of judicial proceedings and the various changes that took place in the judiciary during the process. - The number of victims of gender-based violence who have received legal guidance from lawyers has increased. Around 1 300 birth certificates were issued between 2014 and 2017. - At the institutional level, the implementation of the program saw an expansion of the DEME SO staff and they strengthened their technical and institutional capacities overall, which was necessary for better achievement of the objectives. More detailed information on achieved results are to be found in the final report.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
